name: Proxima Centauri
description: The closest known star to the Sun, a small red dwarf with low luminosity.

name: Sirius A
description: The brightest star in the night sky, known for its high luminosity and white-blue color.

name: Betelgeuse
description: A massive red supergiant nearing the end of its life, expected to explode as a supernova.

name: Rigel
description: A luminous blue supergiant star, one of the brightest stars visible from Earth.

name: PSR B1919+21
description: The first discovered pulsar, a rapidly rotating neutron star emitting radio pulses.

name: Alpha Centauri A
description: A Sun-like star in the Alpha Centauri system, the closest stellar system to Earth.

name: Alpha Centauri B
description: A slightly smaller and cooler companion to Alpha Centauri A.

name: Vega
description: One of the brightest stars in the night sky and part of the Summer Triangle.

name: Altair
description: A fast-rotating bright star, also part of the Summer Triangle.

name: Deneb
description: One of the most luminous stars known, forming part of the Summer Triangle.

name: Polaris
description: The current North Star, located nearly at the north celestial pole.

name: Arcturus
description: A bright orange giant star, the fourth-brightest in the night sky.

name: Aldebaran
description: The brightest star in Taurus, often called the 'Eye of the Bull'.

name: Antares
description: A massive red supergiant star marking the heart of the Scorpion.

name: Spica
description: A very hot and bright blue giant star, the brightest in Virgo.

name: Fomalhaut
description: A bright star surrounded by a well-known debris disk.

name: Capella
description: A bright multiple star system appearing as a single golden star.

name: Canopus
description: The second brightest star in the night sky, used for spacecraft navigation.

name: Eta Carinae
description: An extremely massive and unstable star system likely to go supernova soon.

name: Barnard's Star
description: A nearby red dwarf known for its high proper motion across the sky.

name: Bellatrix
description: A hot blue giant star marking Orion's left shoulder.

name: Saiph
description: A bright blue supergiant star forming Orion’s lower right corner.

name: Mimosa
description: The second brightest star in Crux, part of the Southern Cross.

name: Acrux
description: The brightest star in the Southern Cross constellation.

name: Gacrux
description: A prominent red giant star at the top of the Southern Cross.

name: Shaula
description: A bright blue subgiant star marking the stinger of the Scorpion.

name: Lesath
description: A hot blue subgiant near Shaula, also part of the Scorpion’s tail.

name: Zubenelgenubi
description: A binary star system marking the Alpha star of Libra.

name: Zubeneschamali
description: The brightest star in Libra, noted for its bluish color.

name: Alkaid
description: A hot blue star at the end of the Big Dipper’s handle.

name: Dubhe
description: A bright orange giant forming part of the Big Dipper’s bowl.

name: Merak
description: A white star marking the bottom corner of the Big Dipper’s bowl.

name: Phecda
description: A white main sequence star forming the Big Dipper’s bowl.

name: Megrez
description: The faintest star of the Big Dipper, linking its bowl and handle.

name: Alioth
description: The brightest star in the Big Dipper, known for magnetic activity.

name: Mizar
description: A famous double star in the handle of the Big Dipper.

name: Alcor
description: A companion to Mizar, visible to the naked eye as a close pair.

name: Kochab
description: One of the brighter stars in the Little Dipper, near Polaris.

name: Pherkad
description: A white giant star near Kochab in the Little Dipper.

name: Regulus
description: The brightest star in Leo, located at the Lion’s heart.

name: Denebola
description: A bright white star forming the tail of the Lion in Leo.

name: Algieba
description: A binary system of two orange giants in the mane of Leo.

name: Spica
description: The brightest star in Virgo, a hot blue-white binary system.

name: Vindemiatrix
description: A yellow giant marking the right arm of Virgo.

name: Zavijava
description: A yellow-white star in the head of Virgo.

name: Arcturus
description: A bright orange giant and the fourth brightest star in the night sky.

name: Izar
description: A beautiful binary star with contrasting orange and blue colors.

name: Nekkar
description: A yellow giant star marking the head of the herdsman.

name: Alphecca
description: The brightest star in the Northern Crown, part of a binary system.

name: Gemma
description: Another name for Alphecca, the jewel of the Northern Crown.

name: Antares
description: A massive red supergiant known as the heart of the Scorpion.

name: Dschubba
description: A bright blue subgiant marking the forehead of the Scorpion.

name: Sargas
description: A yellow giant star shining brightly in the tail of Scorpius.

name: Kaus Australis
description: The brightest star in Sagittarius, marking the Archer’s bow.

name: Nunki
description: A hot blue-white star in the handle of the Sagittarius teapot.

name: Ascella
description: A white giant located at the armpit of the Sagittarius archer figure.

name: Rukbat
description: A hot star marking the knee of the Sagittarius constellation.

name: Altair
description: A fast-spinning white star, part of the Summer Triangle.

name: Tarazed
description: An orange giant located near Altair in the constellation Aquila.

name: Deneb
description: A massive supergiant and one of the three Summer Triangle stars.

name: Shaula
description: The second brightest star in Scorpius, a hot blue subgiant nearing the end of its main sequence life.

name: Elnath
description: A bright blue giant marking the tip of the bull's horn in Taurus.

name: Alhena
description: A white subgiant known for its brilliance and position in Gemini's foot.

name: Zubenelgenubi
description: A bright multiple star system marking the scales of Libra.

name: Algol
description: A famous eclipsing binary known as the Demon Star, varying in brightness periodically.

name: Mirfak
description: The brightest star in Perseus, a yellow supergiant surrounded by a cluster of young stars.

name: Wezen
description: A massive supergiant star nearing the end of its life in Canis Major.

name: Sadr
description: A supergiant at the center of the Northern Cross in Cygnus.

name: Markab
description: A blue-white subgiant forming part of the Great Square of Pegasus.

name: Algenib
description: A hot subgiant star marking the corner of the Pegasus Square.

name: Rasalhague
description: The brightest star in Ophiuchus, representing the head of the serpent bearer.

name: Ras Algethi
description: A variable red supergiant, one of the largest known stars in Hercules.

name: Menkent
description: An orange giant star in Centaurus with a calm, steady light.

name: Peacock
description: A hot blue subgiant that shines brightly in the southern constellation Pavo.

name: Diphda
description: A bright orange giant marking the tail of the sea monster Cetus.

name: Achernar
description: A fast-spinning blue star with an oblate shape, at the end of Eridanus.

name: Alpheratz
description: The brightest star in Andromeda, marking the head of the princess.

name: Hamal
description: The brightest star in Aries, an orange giant marking the ram's head.

name: Dubhe
description: One of the pointer stars of the Big Dipper asterism in Ursa Major.

name: Merak
description: A bright star in the Big Dipper used with Dubhe to find Polaris.

name: Eltanin
description: The brightest star in Draco, a cool orange giant.

name: Rastaban
description: One of Draco’s bright stars, shining with a yellow hue.

name: Kochab
description: The brighter of the two 'Guardians of the Pole' near Polaris.

name: Pherkad
description: A white subgiant star, companion to Kochab.

name: Altais
description: A yellow giant in Draco, easily visible to the naked eye.

name: Edasich
description: A moderately bright orange star in Draco.

name: Giausar
description: A red giant star in the constellation Draco.

name: Thuban
description: Once the North Star, it lies near the celestial pole.

name: Alrakis
description: A moderately bright yellow-white star in Draco.

name: Dziban
description: A white star forming part of Draco’s tail.

name: Eltanin B
description: A dim companion to Eltanin in Draco.

name: Adhara
description: The second-brightest star in Canis Major, very luminous and hot.

name: Wezen
description: A massive yellow-white supergiant star.

name: Aludra
description: A blue-white supergiant near the end of its life.

name: Muliphein
description: A bright star that forms part of Canis Major’s outline.

name: Mirzam
description: A hot blue giant also known as Beta Canis Majoris.

name: Furud
description: A hot blue main sequence star in Canis Major.

name: Theta Canis Majoris
description: A white subgiant star in Canis Major.

name: Omega Canis Majoris
description: A rare, extremely hot and luminous B-type subgiant.

name: Sirius B
description: The faint white dwarf companion to Sirius A.

name: Rasalgethi
description: A bright red giant star in Hercules, part of a binary system.

name: Ras Elased Australis
description: A bright orange giant marking the head of Leo the Lion.

name: Ras Elased Borealis
description: An orange giant star in the head of the Leo constellation.

name: Unukalhai
description: The brightest star in Serpens, a cool orange giant.

name: Cebalrai
description: An orange giant star in Ophiuchus nearing the end of its life.

name: Kornephoros
description: The brightest star in Hercules, a hot bluish giant.

name: Sabik
description: A white main-sequence star in the Ophiuchus constellation.

name: Alshain
description: A yellow subgiant in the constellation Aquila.

name: Tarazed
description: A bright orange giant near Altair in Aquila.

name: Okab
description: A white main-sequence star in the Aquila constellation.

name: Al Thalimain
description: A bright white star in the Aquila constellation.

name: Sadalsuud
description: The brightest star in Aquarius, a yellow supergiant.

name: Sadalmelik
description: A luminous yellow supergiant in Aquarius.

name: Skat
description: A white star in the Aquarius constellation.

name: Albali
description: A white star in the Aquarius constellation.

name: Ancha
description: An orange giant star in the Aquarius constellation.

name: Fomalhaut
description: A bright white main-sequence star surrounded by a debris disk.

name: Denebola
description: A bright white star forming the tail of the Leo constellation.

name: Zosma
description: A hot white star in the Leo constellation.

name: Chertan
description: A bright blue-white subgiant in the Leo constellation.

name: Markab
description: A bright giant star forming part of the Great Square of Pegasus.

name: Scheat
description: A cool red giant and the second brightest star in Pegasus.

name: Algenib
description: A hot blue subgiant forming part of the Great Square of Pegasus.

name: Homam
description: A luminous main sequence star in Pegasus, also known as Zeta Pegasi.

name: Enif
description: The brightest star in Pegasus, an evolved orange supergiant.

name: Sadalmelik
description: The brightest star in Aquarius, a yellow supergiant.

name: Sadalsuud
description: The second brightest star in Aquarius, with high luminosity.

name: Skat
description: A white main sequence star in Aquarius, also known as Delta Aquarii.

name: Albali
description: A white star in Aquarius with relatively high rotation speed.

name: Ancha
description: An evolved orange giant star in Aquarius, also known as Theta Aquarii.

name: Fomalhaut
description: One of the brightest nearby stars, surrounded by a debris disk.

name: Deneb Kaitos
description: The brightest star in Cetus, an evolved orange giant.

name: Mira
description: A pulsating red giant star, prototype of Mira variables.

name: Menkar
description: A red giant star marking the head of Cetus.

name: Baten Kaitos
description: An orange giant star in Cetus, also known as Zeta Ceti.

name: Tau Ceti
description: A nearby Sun-like star known for its potential exoplanetary system.

name: Beta Ceti
description: Also known as Diphda, a bright orange giant in Cetus.

name: Zaurak
description: A cool red giant star in the river constellation Eridanus.

name: Cursa
description: A white subgiant star marking the foot of Orion.

name: Achernar
description: A bright, rapidly rotating star that is highly oblate due to its spin.

name: Avior
description: A bright orange giant star in Carina, part of the Southern Cross asterism.

name: Aspidiske
description: A luminous white supergiant star in Carina, also known as Iota Carinae.

name: Miaplacidus
description: The second brightest star in Carina, a white subgiant star.

name: Canopus
description: The second brightest star in the night sky, a massive white supergiant.

name: Tureis
description: An orange giant star in Puppis, also known as Rho Puppis.

name: Naos
description: A very hot and massive blue supergiant in Puppis, also known as Zeta Puppis.

name: Suhail
description: A bright orange supergiant star in Vela, also known as Lambda Velorum.

name: Alsephina
description: Also known as Delta Velorum, a white subgiant and part of a multiple system.

name: Markeb
description: A hot blue-white subgiant in Vela, also called Kappa Velorum.

name: Regor
description: A very massive blue supergiant, also known as Gamma Velorum.

name: Alphard
description: The brightest star in Hydra, an isolated orange giant.

name: Minchir
description: A red giant star in Hydra, also known as Sigma Hydrae.

name: Gamma Hydrae
description: A yellow giant star in the constellation Hydra.

name: Nu Hydrae
description: An evolved orange giant star in Hydra.

name: Theta Hydrae
description: A bright blue-white giant star in Hydra.

name: Ras Elased Australis
description: Also known as Epsilon Leonis, an orange giant in Leo.

name: Ras Elased Borealis
description: Also known as Mu Leonis, a yellow giant star in Leo.

name: Chertan
description: A white main sequence star marking the hip of the Lion.

name: Zosma
description: A hot white main sequence star located on Leo’s back.

name: Algieba
description: A binary orange giant system forming the mane of Leo.

name: Deneb Kaitos
description: Also known as Beta Ceti, the brightest star in Cetus and an orange giant.

name: Mira
description: A famous variable red giant star that changes brightness dramatically over months.

name: Menkar
description: A bright red giant star marking the head of Cetus the Whale.

name: Baten Kaitos
description: An orange giant star in Cetus, also known as Zeta Ceti.

name: Kaffaljidhma
description: Also known as Gamma Ceti, a blue-white subgiant in Cetus.

name: Diphda
description: Also called Beta Ceti, an orange giant star in Cetus.

name: Alderamin
description: The brightest star in Cepheus, a rapidly rotating white main sequence star.

name: Alfirk
description: Also known as Beta Cephei, a variable blue subgiant star in Cepheus.

name: Errai
description: Also known as Gamma Cephei, an orange subgiant that will become the North Star in the future.

name: Alrai
description: Also known as Delta Cephei, the prototype of Cepheid variable stars.

name: Kurhah
description: Also known as Xi Cephei, a white main sequence star in Cepheus.

name: Mu Cephei
description: Also known as Herschel’s Garnet Star, a massive red supergiant.

name: Delta Cephei
description: The prototype of Cepheid variable stars, used to measure cosmic distances.

name: Zeta Cephei
description: A bright orange supergiant star in the constellation Cepheus.

name: Alphirk B
description: A blue-white companion star to Alphirk (Beta Cephei).

name: Kruger 60
description: A nearby red dwarf binary system only 13 light-years away.

name: VV Cephei A
description: One of the largest known stars by radius, a red supergiant.

name: VV Cephei B
description: A hot blue companion to VV Cephei A.

name: Polaris
description: The current North Star, a yellow supergiant and Cepheid variable.

name: Kochab
description: An orange giant star, formerly used as the North Star around 1000 BC.

name: Kepler-22
description: A Sun-like star hosting the first confirmed transiting exoplanet in its habitable zone.

name: 51 Pegasi
description: The first Sun-like star discovered to have an exoplanet orbiting it.

name: Tau Ceti
description: A nearby Sun-like star known for its stability and potential for habitable planets.
